intro: Cissus sciaphila, commonly known as the shade ivy, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and ability to climb using tendrils. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a waxy texture, adapted to thrive in shaded environments.
